The 'Sounds' series by Gio Israel is a window to the worlds' last remaining ancient musical traditions of our time.

The source of Andalusian music is attributed to legendary Persian musician - Ali Iben Nafiaa (AKA "ZRIAB"). Migrating from Syria to the south of Spain (Andalusia) Zriab created 24 musical themes (called "Nubot"), each Nuba represented a different hour in the day.


This new musical tradition then expended to several larger musical traditions of Morocco, Algeria, Tunisia and Libya, as well as been influenced by North African music and style.

The ancient melodies have been managed to survive the test of time due to religious use and mostly through old Jewish communities that have used this types of melodies in their prayers as means to carry their oral traditions, the same that can be heard in old synagogs till this very day.

This series was recorded by musician and composer Gilad Hazan, a respected scholar of Andalusian Music.

222 Samples

Immerse yourself in the genius of genre masters like Tale Of Us, Adriatique, Massano, Innellea, Artbat, and Anyma, and draw from the legacy of acclaimed labels such as Afterlife, Anjunadeep, Crosstown Rebels, and Upperground. Our sound design is masterfully simple, clean, and tightly engineered, but with one goal in mind: to make an unforgettable impact on your audience. Melodic Techno Rawness is your secret weapon for staying ahead of the musical curve. Dive into the depths of one of the hottest sounds in the industry right now. Sad Girl Sex Tapes is a collection of over 200 vocal samples, expertly crafted and curated to suit a wide range of sonic possibilities. Expect to find lush vocal pads to crisp accapella hooks, instrumental song starters and spoken word sound bites. Sad Girl Sex Tapes is a versatile sample pack that can be used for a variety of genres, including Sad Girl Pop, Dream Pop, R&B, Rap, Electronic Dance, and Soul. The samples are royalty-free and tempo-synced for ease of use.


The samples were recorded and engineered by Dylan Wood at Sound Factory studio in Los Angeles using a variety of vintage and modern gear, including the Electro-Voice 664 for the vintage textures, and the Manley Gold for that modern, clear, sparkling fidelity. The warm and wide reverb was created using Sound Factories analogue plate reverb.

As a producer and a songwriter, Nylo curated the samples from the mindset of creation and momentum, generating sounds that can be the first drop of paint on an empty musical canvas or lyrics to guide a creator into an idea just under the surface. The background vocal arrangements are meant to push a track that's almost there over the finish line, and the vocal adlibs and one-shots can be re-sampled and turned into something entirely new or used as is, to give each song that much needed signature sample.

Nylo is a platinum artist/producer and early pioneer in the downtempo movement, blending soul, R&B, and electronica. Collaborations include artists like Zhu, G-Eazy, Majid Jordan, and Mac Miller, and outside of the studio she's toured the world as a musical director and multi-instrumentalist for artists like Yuna, Sohn, and many more.

224 Samples

If you've used NI's Guitar Rig in the past, you already know what a powerful tool it is for guitar and bass. In this Guitar Rig 7 Pro video course, amp sim expert Gary Hiebner gives you an in-depth video manual with examples of everything Guitar Rig 7 Pro, covering all the bases, from all the amp and cabinet models and effects to all the other useful tools such as the new Signal Flow sidebar, MIDI functionality, the new Loop Machine Pro, and much more! By the end of the Guitar Rig 7 Pro course, you'll have a firm grasp on everything this tone powerhouse can do and will be ready to start getting killer sounds right away! These videos are designed for new Guitar Rig 7 Pro users.

Gary begins by welcoming you to the course and explaining how to set up your audio interface to properly interface with Guitar Rig 7 Pro. You'll then learn the lay of the land with a tour of the interface and a demonstration of how to use the Browser to try out presets, save changes, etc. Then Gary covers the new Signal Flow sidebar view, which allows you to quickly get a complete view of your signal chain and make changes - from simple to complex - quickly and easily.

Next, Gary dives into the amp components, where you'll see how to tweak parameters like gain, EQ, etc. and also see how to select different cabinets for different tones. Learn also how to load various cabinet impulse responses for even more tonal variation and hear how NI's ICM technology faithfully recreates the sound of coveted vintage gear.

This only scratches the surface, and there's much more to come, including tutorials dedicated to each type of effect (overdrive, distortion/fuzz, delays/reverbs, modulation, compression, pitch effects, and more), and new lo-fi effects Tape Wobble, Vintage Vibrato, and Noise Machine, the new Loop Machine Pro (looper with advanced features for use in live settings), Tools (helpful for setting up various signal and processing chains), macro assignment, MIDI Learn (for control of effects like wah via an external MIDI controller), and more! To close out the course, Gary shows you how to create several different tones from scratch: vintage clean, dirty overdriven, modern metal, Swedish metal, and more!

Native Instruments has really thrown down the gauntlet with Guitar Rig 7 Pro, and this course is the quickest way to fully grasp all it can do. With plenty of audio demonstrations, you'll quickly realize how amazing this plug-in truly is when it comes to easily getting the perfect tone for guitar or bass. Check out the individual Guitar Rig 7 Pro video tutorial descriptions for more info and ideas on how you can integrate it into your own workflow for your very next production. Your perfect tone awaits... watch "Guitar Rig 7 Pro Explained®" today!

What You Will Learn:

-How to tweak amp parameters and select various cabinets for tonal variation, including impulse response cabinets

-Detailed explanation of all types of effects (distortion, reverb, delay, modulation, compression, etc.)

-How to create full guitar arrangements in the studio and on the stage with the new Loop Machine Pro

-Assigning macros to select parameters for easy, fast tweaking of your most commonly used elements

-And much more!

home page:

https://goo.su/LHKSUK

FileCat - Groove3 Guitar Rig 7 Pro Explained.rar

Soulmates - Vintage Classics’ is a curated collection of original soul samples, vintage vocals, live instrument loops, and vinyl cut melodics. Paying tribute to the classic soul records that have shaped hip-hop and continue to inspire. For the crate diggers, vinyl lovers, and modern producers searching for rare gems. Plus select cuts, flipped and resampled into chopped loops, dripping in vinyl and tape nostalgia. Proudly presented by 91Vocals in collaboration with Arthouse Acoustics.


This collection builds on the foundations of extensive composition, arrangement, and recording by a team of experienced professional musicians inspired by the rich history of soul music. Arthouse Acoustics used vintage mics and analog preamps to capture live performances and emulate the warmth and character of true-to-era production techniques. India born, California raised songstress Zoya brings her unique brand of catchy pop to VOX, delivering an exciting collection of vocal loops including melodically inspiring top-line hooks and phrases (both as wet and dry samples), processed vocoders, chopped, adlibs and one shot vocal FX, pitched and spoken word samples.

Zoya’s music has been recognised by AR Rahman and The Chainsmokers, featured Grammy Award Winning rapper ‘Jack Harlow’ on her debut album, works closely with Mark Milan (Lady Gaga) and Chuck Inglish (Chance the Rapper) and has supported tours with the likes of Kawehi, Natty, Lucy Rose, Madame Gandhi, Youngr, Submotion Orchestra, Bloc Party, Clean Bandit and Martin Garrix. Africana 2’ is part 2 of a soulful fusion of classic Afrobeat sauce and modern amapiano groove. Africana 2 utilises real instruments alongside electronic synthesis. The funky rhythms and musical excellence are enough to make any dance floor pulsate.

This pack will give you the opportunity to understand how afrobeats music is made on a deeper level by piecing each deconstructed layer together, sample by sample.

From emotive and; fun guitar chord progressions to soulful synth melodies, this pack covers a wide array of afrobeat ideas and compositions. There is an eclectic mixture of sounds and instruments throughout the pack, all sure to inspire your next beat.

If you enjoy this library, make sure to check out ‘Africana’.

Vocals are one of the most important elements of any music, as they are often where the epicentre of expression in a track is located. When it comes to electronic music, this is perhaps even more true, as they provide the human connection to sounds that could otherwise feel cold and lifeless. This philosophy pertains strongly to the music of D.Ramirez, the magisterial DJ and producer from Sheffield who brings his vocal hook prowess to an action-packed series of courses that cover seven electronic genres. In this course, he dives deep into vocal hooks within the Tech House genre.

D.Ramirez is a bona fide star whose music has taken him to every corner of the globe in a sparkling career that has seen him operating at full throttle for over twenty years. He's manned the ones and twos in some the worlds' best clubs from Space & Cream Ibiza, Womb in Tokyo and Avalon in LA; and dropped iconic sets at festivals like Glastonbury, Global Gathering and Australia Day in Sydney. Initially known for almost single-handedly coining the famed electrohouse sound, D.Ramirez has moved seamlessly into deep house and techno stylings in the last decade, and his ability to flip an acapella into a chart-topping vocal are unparalleled.

In this course, D.Ramirez teaches you everything you need to know to find and deploy acapellas to create earworm vocal hooks in your electronic productions. You'll learn the ins and outs of modern sampling techniques, using content platforms like YouTube as well as royalty-free sample subscription services like Splice. Never one to do things by halves, D.Ramirez breaks down the finer points of arrangement, editing and effects processing.

D.Ramirez production chops have led to him collecting accolades from the likes of DJ Magazine (best producer and best remix), iDJ (player of the year) and even an Ivor Novello nomination for his remix of Bodyrox 'Yeah Yeah'. He's even been on Top of the Pops! All of these accolades only confirm the high regard D.Ramirez is held in in the dance music community, which makes him the ideal instructor for this unmissable vocal hooks masterclass. Whether you want to know how to find the best acapellas out there today, or how to write, record and refine original vocals, this course is the one for you!

Chapters (all of them compacted in one MP4 file) :

Chapter 0: Tech House Intro
Chapter 1: YouTube Acapellas
Chapter 2: Search Keywords
Chapter 3: Sourcing and Sampling
Chapter 4: Editing Samples in Ableton
Chapter 5: Further Editing
Chapter 6: Building the Arrangement
